III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation A Staff member pushed a youth.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Youth A stated he punched Youth B in the
face and Supervisor “held him back.” Youth A reported he was
“attacking” Youth B and Youth C and Supervisor “moved” him
away from Youth B and Youth C. Youth A was not able to
describe how Supervisor held him back or moved him away from
Youth B and Youth C. Youth A denied he was pushed or shoved
by Supervisor.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Youth B reported Youth A hit him last week
and was placed in a restraint. Youth B stated he could not recall
the positioning of staff’s hands on Youth A during the restraint.
Youth B reported he did not think any staff member pushed Youth
A.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Youth C described being kicked in his chin
by Youth A after Youth A punched Youth B. Youth C reported a
staff checked on him (could not recall staff’s name) while
Supervisor kept Youth A “back.” Youth C stated Supervisor had
her hands out trying to keep Youth A away from Youth C and
Youth B. Youth C reported he could not recall if Supervisor was
touching or holding any part of Youth A’s body. Youth C denied
seeing Supervisor or any staff member push Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Staff 1 described getting called for
assistance and walking into the hallway to see “Supervisor trying
to stop Youth A from doing something to her.” Staff 1 reported
Youth A’s back was to Staff 1, and he could see Youth A over
Supervisor, who was leaning up against the wall or some doors.
Staff 1 denied seeing Supervisor push or shove Youth A. Staff 1
described everything happening quickly.
2

Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Supervisor described being in the hall with
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C waiting for the lab technician.
Supervisor stated Youth A was upset about having to wait, walked
over to Youth C and kicked him in the neck, walked away and
then approached Youth B and punched him. Supervisor stated
she verbally redirected Youth A, he “locked eyes” with her and
came after her. Supervisor described being in a “power struggle”
with Youth A trying to stop him from hitting her. Supervisor stated
Youth A did not actually hit her, only scratched her. Supervisor
reported she was holding Youth A’s arms trying to stop him from
hitting her. Supervisor stated that Nurse removed Youth B and
Youth C from the hallway, so Supervisor released Youth A’s arms.
Supervisor denied pushing or shoving Youth A at any time.
Supervisor stated she was “staying disengaged from Youth A.”
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Staff 2 described hearing “ruckus” in the
hallway so went to assist. Staff 2 stated she saw Youth A hitting
Supervisor. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 entered the area to assist and
was able to move Youth A away from Supervisor. Staff 2 denied
seeing Supervisor push or shove Youth A. Staff 2 reported
Supervisor was shielding herself from Youth A who was kicking,
hitting and spitting.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Nurse described Youth A becoming
increasingly upset while waiting for lab draws because the
technician was running late. Nurse reported Supervisor was
talking to Youth A trying to calm him down. Nurse stated that
Youth A kicked one youth in the face and then punched another
youth. Nurse reported Supervisor moved toward Youth A to get
in-between Youth A and the other youths. Nurse stated she
believed Supervisor had her arms up to stop Youth A but could
not recall if Supervisor was holding Youth A’s arms or not. Nurse
denied seeing Supervisor push or shove Youth A at any time.
Video Review
Video footage of 9/10/2025 in the hallway was reviewed on
9/17/2025. Video shows Youth A walk down the hallway toward
Youth C, who is sitting on the floor, and kick Youth C. Supervisor
pushes Youth A away from Youth C. Youth B is standing further
down the hallway and Nurse is on the other side of Supervisor and
Youth A. Youth A walks away after being pushed and Supervisor
and Nurse bend down to check on Youth C. Youth A approaches
3

again and punches Youth B in the face. Supervisor pushes Youth
A away with her left hand then steps in-between Youth A and
Youth B. Youth A steps toward Supervisor, Supervisor stretches
out both arms in front of her and pushes Youth A down the hall,
away from Youth B with both her hands.
Documents Reviewed:
• Supervisor’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary
record and Supervisor completed Non-violent crisis
prevention intervention, CPI, on 6/26/25.
• Havenwyck Hospital Proper Use and Monitoring of Physical
Restraints Policy. Policy documents, “The following forms
of intervention are strictly prohibited; hitting, or striking,
throwing, kicking, pulling or pushing a youth on any part of
their body.”
• Incident Report 219480265 which was consistent with staff
and youths’ interviews, but it did not document that
Supervisor pushed Youth A away from Youth C.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per video review,
Supervisor pushed Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Description restraints; elimination of restraints
(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth was held against the wall with their back towards the wall
while being restrained by a staff member at the facility.
Investigation Emails were exchanged with Complainant on September 16,
2025, and they reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Youth A reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 came
to assist Supervisor and Youth A was placed in a restraint. Youth
A described punching Staff 1 and spitting on Staff 1 and Staff 2.
4

Youth A stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 were asking him to stop spitting
and “talking to me to help calm me down.” Youth A reported Staff
2 placed her hand over his mouth to have him stop spitting. Youth
A denied having difficulty breathing. Youth A stated Staff 1 was
behind Youth A holding his arms and Staff 2 was standing on
Youth A’s side holding his arm. Youth A reported he could not
recall what side Staff 2 was standing on. Youth A stated he
thought he was facing the wall but could not recall. Youth A
stated this restraint was done the same way other restraints are
done. Youth A denied having any concerns about the restraint.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Youth B reported Youth A hit him last week
and was placed in a restraint. Youth B stated Youth A also hit
Youth C before being placed in a restraint. Youth B reported he
could not recall what staff placed Youth B in the restraint. Youth B
stated he could not recall the positioning of staff’s hands on Youth
A during the restraint. Youth B denied having any concerns with
how staff did the restraint. Youth B described being moved out of
the area when Youth A was being placed in the restraint. Youth B
reported he could not recall what staff member moved him and
Youth C out of the area, away from Youth A.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Youth C described being kicked in his chin
by Youth A after Youth A punched Youth B. Youth C reported a
staff checked on him (could not recall staff’s name) while
Supervisor kept Youth A “back.” Youth C described leaving the
area and going to his room, so he did not see Youth A being
restrained.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Staff 1 described getting called for
assistance and walking into the hallway to see “Supervisor trying
to stop Youth A from doing something to her.” Staff 1 reported he
walked toward Youth A and Youth A turned around and started
swinging at Staff 1. Staff 1 described Youth A swinging his hands
and attempting to punch Staff 1 in the face. Staff 1 stated he was
in front of Youth A, holding each of Youth A’s hands with each of
his hands and Youth A backed up to the wall. Staff 1 reported
Staff 2 came to Youth A’s side and kept saying, “[Youth A], I’m
here, I’m here.” Staff 1 described Youth A having a good rapport
with Staff 2 and Staff 2, usually being able to help calm Youth A.
Staff 1 stated Youth A started spitting at Staff 1 and Staff 2 while
continuing to try and punch Staff 1. Staff 1 reported he continued
to stand in front of Youth A holding each of Youth A’s wrists with
5

his hands while Staff 2 left to get a towel. Staff 1 denied seeing
Staff 2 place her hand on Youth A’s mouth when Youth A was
spitting. Staff 1 stated Staff 2’s hand was hovering over Youth A’s
mouth but not touching Youth A. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 entered
the hallway to assist and stood on the side of Youth A. Staff 1
reported Youth A kept trying to go to the ground, so Staff 1 let go
of Youth A’s wrists and Youth A sat on the ground while Staff 2
talked to Youth A. Staff 1 stated Youth A was leaning up against
the wall but denied holding Youth A to the wall. Staff 1 reported
he “just held his [Youth A] hands so he would not hit me.” Staff 1
reported trying to go into a control hold, but Youth A was swinging
his hands trying to punch Staff 1 that a control hold was not
successful.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Supervisor described Youth A coming at
her, trying to hit and kick her. Supervisor reported Staff 1 and
Staff 2 entered the hallway to assist while Nurse got Youth B and
Youth C out of the hallway. Supervisor stated Staff 1 “grabbed
Youth A and moved Youth A away from me.” Supervisor reported
Staff 1 had Youth A’s arms and moved Youth A toward the corner
while Staff 2 assisted. Supervisor described Staff 1 standing in
front of Youth A holding Youth A’s hands, while Staff 2 was
standing on the side of Youth A talking to Youth A. Supervisor
reported Youth A was trying to punch Staff 1 and was spitting on
both Staff 1 and Staff 2. Supervisor stated she ran and got a
towel to hold as a shield from Youth A spitting on Staff 1 and Staff
2. Supervisor denied seeing Staff 2 place her hand over Youth
A’s mouth. Supervisor stated Staff 2’s hand was hovering over
Youth A’s mouth but not touching Youth A’s face.
Supervisor described Youth A as being near the wall but was not
sure if Youth A’s back was up against the wall. Supervisor denied
having concerns with the restraint or how Staff 1 and Staff 2 were
positioned. Supervisor stated they [Staff 1 and Staff 2] “were on
point, trying to sooth and calm Youth A.” Supervisor reported that
normally staff are at the sides of a youth during a restraint, but
Youth A was trying to punch Staff 1 so only Staff 2 was at Youth
A’s side. Supervisor stated she believes everything was done
appropriately.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Staff 2 described assisting Staff 1 as Youth
A was punching and spitting. Staff 2 stated she kept saying,
“[Youth A] I’m here, I’m here.” Staff 2 reported she has a good
rapport with Youth A and is usually able to help calm him. Staff 2
6

described Staff 1 as standing in front of Youth A holding either
both or just one of Youth A’s hands. Staff 2 stated she was
standing at the side of Youth A trying to get Youth A’s arm to
place him in a control hold but was not successful as Youth A
continued to move and punch Staff 1. Staff 2 reported staff use a
team control but could not get in the correct position with Youth A
because Youth A was “attacking us [Staff 1 and Staff 2].” Staff 2
stated the wall is not used in a team control restraint, but they
[Staff 1 and Staff 2] never got into a team control. Staff 2 reported
that Youth A’s back was up against the wall at times, but he was
not being pushed up against the wall. Staff 2 described Youth A
moving back and forth and fighting against Staff 1 and Staff 2, so
they were all moving back and forth at times.
Staff 2 stated Youth A was spitting at her and Staff 1, so she held
her hand in front of Youth A’s face to block the spit. Staff 2 denied
covering Youth A’s mouth or touching his face with her hand.
Staff 2 described continuing to talk to Youth A, asking him to sit
and talk with her. Staff 2 reported eventually Youth A sat down
and she sat and talked with him. Staff 2 stated she did not have
any concerns.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2025. Nurse described Staff 1 and Staff 2 coming
to assist with Youth A because Youth A was trying to punch
Supervisor. Nurse stated she was on the phone calling for
assistance for more staff. Nurse reported Staff 1 was on Youth
A’s left side and Staff 2 was on Youth A’s right side. Nurse stated
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were verbally redirecting Youth A and trying to
help deescalate him. Nurse reported Youth A’s back was against
the wall as staff stood on the sides of Youth A. Nurse denied
Youth A being pushed up against the wall during the restraint.
Nurse stated this was the first restraint she had witnessed at the
facility as she recently started working. Nurse reported she did
not have any concerns with how Staff 1 and Staff 2 intervened.
Video Review
Video footage of 9/10/2025 in the hallway was reviewed on
9/17/2025. Nurse is on the phone, Staff 1 enters the hallway,
approaches Youth A who turns toward Staff 1 and begins
punching Staff 1. Staff 1 deflects the punches with his hands
while standing in front of Youth A. Staff 2 is seen entering the
camera view assisting Staff 1 from the side. Staff 1 places his
right hand on Youth A’s left bicep and his left hand on Youth A’s
right elbow and moves Youth A away from Supervisor. Staff 2
guides Youth A across the hall and Youth A moves to the wall.
7

Youth A’s back is against the wall as he continues to try and
punch Staff 1 and spit on Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 1 continues
standing in front of Youth A with his right hand holding Youth A’s
left upper arm. Staff 2 is holding her right hand in front of Youth
A’s face while standing at Youth A’s right side. At one point Staff
2 appears to place her left palm on the side of Youth A’s face with
her fingers extended, her fingers not touching Youth A’s face or
mouth. Youth A continues to move his head back and forth and
spit on Staff 1 and Staff 2. Youth A is seen moving back and
forth, spinning around and then dropping to the ground. Staff 1
and Staff 2 release Youth A. The video never shows Staff 1 and
Staff 2 getting into the appropriate team control restraint.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was one employee corrective
action reported dated 7/23/24 regarding Staff 1 using a loud
tone when talking with a youth. Staff 1 completed Non-
violent crisis prevention intervention, CPI, in September of
2024.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 2 completed Non-violent crisis prevention
intervention, CPI, on 11/14/24.
• Havenwyck Hospital Proper Use and Monitoring of Physical
Restraints Policy. Policy documents, “Physical restraints
(holds) may only be done using techniques trained through
the nonviolent crisis intervention program (CPI).”
• Incident Report 219480265 which was consistent with staff
and youths’ interviews.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per staff interviews and
video review, the proper team control restraint technique was not
used by Staff 1 and Staff 2.
CONSULTATION:
Consultation was offered to retrain staff on CPI techniques and
how staff can better assist one another during interventions and
restraints. It is also recommended the facility review the restraint
videos with staff as a training tool to discuss how to better get in
the correct position when youth are spitting and punching at staff.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
8

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
